docs.lead_paragraph: By settling its dispute with MBIA, Morgan Stanley can increase regulatory capital and begin 2012 on more solid footing.

headline.main: Morgan Stanley Has More to Do
headline.print_headline: Morgan Stanley Has More to Do

docs.abstract: Morgan Stanley's settlement with MBIA puts company on right track to increase regulatory capital and begin 2012 on more solid footing; divided OPEC is unlikely to tighten its ever-loosening grip on the oil market.
docs.snippet: By settling its dispute with MBIA, Morgan Stanley can increase regulatory capital and begin 2012 on more solid footing.

docs.lead_paragraph: New York reimburses nonprofit providers for home care for the developmentally disabled at such beneficial rates that it has led to multimillion-dollar surpluses and eye-popping salaries.

headline.seo: New York Nonprofits Giving Home Care to Developmentally Disabled Swim in State Money
headline.main: Aiding Disabled, Nonprofits Rake in State Money
headline.print_headline: Aiding Disabled, Nonprofits Rake In State Money

docs.abstract: New York State reimburses nonprofit providers for home care for the developmentally disabled at such beneficial rates that it has led to multimillion-dollar surpluses and eye-popping salaries; spending on program, called Community Habitation, helps to explain how state's costs of caring for developmentally disabled people have ballooned, creating the nation's most generous system of Medicaid-financed programs, with little scrutiny of its efficiency or results (Series: Abused and Used).
docs.snippet: New York reimburses nonprofit providers for home care for the developmentally disabled at such beneficial rates that it has led to multimillion-dollar surpluses and eye-popping salaries.

headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Bill Would Benefit Doctor-Owned Hospitals

docs.abstract: House Republicans' proposed bill to hold down payroll taxes and extend unemployment benefits also includes a special dispensation to doctors who invest in hospitals, which could benefit dozens of hospitals and their physician owners.

docs.lead_paragraph: The policy conceit that spending money on patients who die is a waste overlooks the core purpose of health care.

headline.main: When Care Is Worth It, Even if End Is Death
headline.print_headline: When Care Is Worth It, Even if End Is Death

docs.abstract: Dr Peter R Bach essay questions popular notion that excessive health care is wasted on terminal patients; says policy makers who rely too heavily on metrics that judge hospital performance by amount of 'wasted' treatments are missing the core purpose of health care.
docs.snippet: The policy conceit that spending money on patients who die is a waste overlooks the core purpose of health care.

headline.main: Reid Vows to Keep Republicans in Town

docs.abstract: The Senate majority leader says he will block votes on bill to finance the government until Democrats get a bill they like on extending payroll tax cut and unemployment insurance,
docs.snippet: The Senate majority leader says he will block votes on bill to finance the government until Democrats get a bill they like on extending payroll tax cut and unemployment insurance,

docs.lead_paragraph: In league with President Obama, the Senate majority leader, Harry Reid, served notice to Congressional Republicans late Monday that he will prevent final votes on a must-pass bill to finance government operations until Congress approves a measure to Democrats' liking that extends a payroll tax cut and unemployment assistance.
